text: Prostate cancer is a disease in which cancer develops in the prostate, a gland in the male reproductive system. It is often treated with prostatectomy, radiotherapy, or hormonal therapy.Mayo Clinic. Prostate cancer: treatment and drugs Aggressive prostate cancer is now known to have a genetic basis. Men with gene BRCA2 are more likely to get the cancer, and more likely it will be in its most aggressive form.Roberts, Michelle 2013. 'Aggressive' prostate cancer gene find. BBC News online: Health. ==Other websites== *HIFU information at Prostate Cancer UK == References == Category:Medicine Category:Cancer C Category:Male reproductive system
title: Prostate cancer
